scenario_text.value: Looks like we managed to win.

Yeah. Although is it just me, or were those
monsters acting weird?

No, it definitely wasn’t just you... You guys
weren’t working with them, were you?

How many times do I have to tell you? No!
Absolutely not!

Have you forgotten? We share a tight bond
with you humans. Our fates are linked.

Yeah, well, the way I see it, that bond still
only takes you so far.

Just look at Shuuji and Lopmon, or Ryo and
Kunemon. They were just like us.

So why did they have to die the way that they
did, huh? Answer me that, Falcomon!

I don’t know why things turned out that way
or what threw their fates into such disarray.

I don’t have the answers for everything,
as much as I wish I did.

Exactly! So who’s to say you guys won’t
do the same thing to us eventually, too?!

How do we know you’re on our side? That you
won’t attack us if we make one wrong move?

So, you’re saying you don’t trust us?
Is that it, Minoru?

You’ve got it all wrong! I would never do
anything to hurt Takuma! Never!

How can you be so sure about that, Agumon?
You don’t know what the future holds.
Aoi, you know I won’t hurt you, right?
Of course, Labramon. I trust you. But...

It’s not like I really meant what I said.
You’re being dramatic, Falcomon!
Hmph. Am I now?

What are you going to do, Minoru? Are we good
for now?

...Yeah, we’re good. Falcomon’s the one who
doesn’t know how to take a joke.

Oh, there you all are! I’ve been looking for
you kids.
Oh, Professor. How did your search go?

I went past the shopping district, but all
I could see were more ruins after that.

I was very careful to avoid enemies. It’s
pretty much the same as our island, though.

Something seems to be happening in the
forest, though. What’s your call?

In that case, let’s go there. It sounds like
it might be worth checking out.

(That’s also the direction where Falcomon
headed off to, so all the more reason to go.)
All right, everyone, let’s get... Hmm?

Takuma, it’s kind of hard to leave the way
things are right now.
That’s true, I guess.
Huh? Where’s Falcomon?
Well, about that...
He...took off somewhere. I don’t know where.

I see. I think I know what happened. After
such an ordeal, it’s hardly surprising.

(The Professor didn’t mention Shuuji or
Lopmon, but it’s clear he meant them.)

Having said that, I’ve been thinking about
something for a while now.

Specifically, the Kemonogami who were said to
ward off disaster and protect their masters.

They share an awful lot with the monsters
accompanying you all.
They do?

Yes. So much so, in fact, that I’d go so far
as to say these monsters are the Kemonogami.

After all, it’s because of their protection
that you all have made it this far.
Then why did Lopmon turn out how he did?

The records say that the Kemonogami reflect
their master’s hearts.

That is to say, Lopmon’s transformation was
likely a manifestation of Shuuji’s own heart.
That’s how Shuuji felt inside...?

Should a Kemonogami be mishandled, their
master will ultimately pay the price.

In essence, the state of a human’s heart is
crucial in the growth of a Kemonogami.

(Meaning that we need Agumon and the other
monsters just as much as they need us?!)

So what you’re saying is there was a reason
why all of us were gathered at the shrine?
Most likely, yes.

(Huh? Am I imagining things or does he keep
looking at Miyuki and Haru...? Maybe not.)

That’s a relief. I’m glad this wasn’t just
all my fault.
Yeah, Miu. You didn’t cause this.

If we split up like this, we’ll just give the
enemy what they want. So let’s find Falcomon!
